 Floe Page 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe Page Â¶ 
 Floes are the core of  Orion . Floes are constructed of cubes, which are small programming elements. Floes and cubes
are uploaded and incorporated into  Orion  as tar packages or docker images. (See  the development instructions
in the Programming Guide for more information about packaging .) When loaded, floes can be
shared like any other dataset. Uploaded
floes are found in and run from the  Floes  tab and the  Editor  tab.
In the  Floes  tab, they can also be assigned to other feature domains. 
 
 When a floe is launched, its progress can be
followed graphically and in real time.  A floe in progress is shown in the  Jobs  tab, with different
colors indicating the status of the cubes. 
 
 
 Figure 1. A Floe in Progress Â¶ 
 
 
 
 
 A cost analysis is available before, during, and after each
floe. After each floe completes, a notification is posted that can be viewed by clicking the  Notifications  icon ( ).
(When you launch a floe, or in your profile, you can also ask to receive an email when a job completes.)   The job
may also produce output datasets or an
HTML report file. A log file of the floe job is also presented. 
 Job cost alerts can be set globally for all floe runs in the Profile section.
Users can modify job cost thresholds in the Job Form before launching a floe and during the run. 
 
 Specify a Path when Launching a Floe Run Â¶ 
 A path or location can be specified in the job
submission form. When launching a floe run, you will see an
 Output   path  property field. The default path will be
 Project   Name/My   Data . You can type in a new directory name,
which will be created when the output is written. To go up a directory, click on
the up arrow or use the backspace key to move up one
directory. Finally, select the path you want. 
 
 
 Find a Floe in Orion Â¶ 
 You can find a particular floe, out of the many available, using the  Floe  page with these techniques: 
 
 Navigate to the floe using the categories in the left-hand pane. 
 
 The  Created   in   Floe   Editor  category shows floes that do not have an associated package and thus were likely
created in the  Editor .   See the Programming Guide for more information about the Floe
Editor . 
 The  Packages  category groups floes according to the packages in which they are built.  You may be familiar
with this nomenclature from past releases.  For example, selecting the package  OpenEye  Biomodeler Floes in the
drop-down displays the floes associated with that package. 
 The  Product-based  category corresponds to the names of  OpenEye  products, such as  BROOD .  This
category is one deep: if you select  BROOD , you will get the list of floes associated with that product, displayed
in the right-hand pane. 
 The  Role-based ,  Solution-based , and  Task-based  categories are deeper, meaning you might go through
one or more subcategories to get to a specific list of floes. 
 
 
 Search for the floe using the search bar labeled âSearch Floes and Categoriesâ in the right-hand pane.  This search looks for
the search term among the category terms and in the brief description of the floe.  The brief appears in a list of
floes; it is not the longer description that appears when you display an individual floe.
The search should give you a concise list of relevant floes. 
 
 
 
 Figure 2. You Can Search for Floes or Navigate to Them by Categories Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Figure 3. Result of Navigating to Solution-Based / Virtual-Screening / Analysis / Bemis-Murcko Â¶

 2022.2.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2022.2.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 Floes are now organized by category. They can appear
in multiple categories. The following categories are available in the 2022.2 release: 
 
 Created   in   Floe   Editor 
 Packages 
 Product-based 
 Role-based 
 Solution-based 
 Task-based 
 
 
 Floes now have a new âBrief,â which is a short description of the Floe.
Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe brief. 
 Users can now create shareable links to the current view of the  3D   Modeling  and  Analyze  pages. 
 Downloadable dataset, file, and folder links can now be generated from the Data page and shared with other users. 
 A new login experience is available. All users are now guided through the appropriate login process
for their underlying implementation. 
 A new load screen is now displayed on login or when Orion is loading certain resources such as Floe reports. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Support for new Intel processors has been added. 
 For Floes that use GPUs, the  NVIDIA driver version is now 470.103.01. 
 A userâs full name is now displayed on the Navigation bar. 
 A local account is now locked after multiple failed change password attempts. 
 The message in the Job debug collection info email has been improved. The path to the debug file is now specified,
and the message includes a reminder
that users must be logged into Orion to access the file. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that impacted the scale up of ASGs when there are not enough instances has been fixed. 
 Large GPU instances are now evenly apportioned. 
 An issue that caused some jobs to hang indefinitely has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 In certain situations, users were not able to cancel running jobs. This issue has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The Project Summary page has been redesigned and improved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Downloadable dataset or file links can now be generated from the Data page and shared with other users. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 When launching Floes from the Project Data page, the output path option is now present. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now create a shareable link to the current view on the 3D Modeling page using the
Snapshot button in the menu bar.

 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now create a shareable link to the current view of the Analyze page using the Snapshot button in the menu bar. 
 Substructure filtering now allows the inclusion of query features for more useful substructure matching. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused newly added ratings and properties to be unavailable for filtering until an Orion reload has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Floes are now classified into the following categories: 
 
 
 Created   in   Floe   Editor

 Product-based 
 Role-based

 For a complete description of the categories in the 2022.2.1 release, see  the documentation about the Floe page in this manual . 
 
 The Floe browser allows users to search for any Floe in any category and the state of search and category path will persist.

 2021.2.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2021.2.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 The 2021.2.1 release marks a major milestone in OrionÂ® releases. The Orion Platform release is now
decoupled from the Science Suites or Floe packages release. Science Suites now closely track the Apps and Toolkits releases. 
 Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe description. Title matches are listed before description matches. 
 Floes are now sorted by title rather than by name. 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  Analyze  and  3D   Modeling  pages. 
 New icons have been introduced for collections  , datasets  , and files  . 
 Read-only folders, collections, datasets, and files have special icons marked with a   icon. 
 Shared Spaces can be identified by a   icon. 
 Job cost notification now reports estimated job cost plus OpenEyeâs markup. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Job cost notification now reports estimated job cost plus OpenEyeâs markup. 
 The requirements for  finalize dataset  task have been increased to  cpu=1 ,  memory=1024.0 ,  disk_space=22000.0 . 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A scheduler issue in Floe networking causing cyclic Floes to deadlock has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A request to cancel a running rate-limited job sent from  Orion-client  is no longer throttled. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Documents and molecular files uploaded as âProject Filesâ are now placed in Team Data. No ETL Floes are run on these files. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Edits of project descriptions can now be saved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Collections, datasets, and files are now labeled with unique icons. A   icon depicts a collection, a  
icon depicts a dataset, and a   icon depicts a file. 
 Read-only folders, collections, datasets, and files have special icons marked with a   icon. For example, a read-only folder
will be denoted as  . 
 Shared Spaces can be identified by a   icon. 
 Dataset depictions are displayed faster. 
 Shared spaces can now be deleted. 
 Discussion Boards can now be moved between My Data and Shared Spaces. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Moving a folder now moves the folder and all of its contents. 
 A bug that limited the number of folders listed in the Path Selector when saving or moving datasets has been fixed.  Users can now load more folders, if they exist. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused the Active Data list to sometimes list search results instead of the active data has been fixed. 
 Selecting âView Resultsâ on the  Jobs  page now searches all folders in the current project and displays all resource types. 
 Searching for resources by Job Id on the  Project   Data  page could show those resources in the Trash and Active Data folders as well. This issue has been fixed. 
 Moving a dataset from Active Data to another project now clears the data from Active Data. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  3D   Modeling  page. 
 Discussion Boards will throw a warning if a snapshot is missing datasets. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Nucleic acids are displayed by default when they are part of a DesignUnit. 
 When editing a protein, protein mutation tools now work properly. 
 A ligand in a DesignUnit can now be edited without the associated protein. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 3D Modeling snapshots in Discussion Boards now include grid contour information. 
 Memory management improvements have been made to the  3D   Modeling  page. 
 Deleting a pinned record now removes it from the Objects list. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  Analyze  page. 
 Discussion Boards will throw a warning if a snapshot is missing datasets. 
 Loading of data is now faster, particularly for smaller datasets and when filtering. 
 The Databar has been restyled and now more prominently labels the number of active and total filters. 
 Substructure filters now show the substructure with the filter. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused some inconsistent vertical and/or horizontal scrolling behavior in the spreadsheet has been fixed. 
 Binning of columns with the same name from different datasets now properly merges the data. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Pinned columns in the spreadsheet are now remembered. 
 A bug that caused the spreadsheet scrollbar to sometimes disappear has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe description. Title matches are listed before description matches. 
 Floes are now sorted by title rather than by name. 
 SecretInputParameters are now supported in the UI. 
 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 R-groups and isotopes can now be set in the sketcher via a right-click on atoms. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Parameters fixed in the Floe Editor can now be removed. 
 The Start Job button in the Floe dialog could be disabled if a String parameter was
required but had an empty string as a default. This issue has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Ledger entries now load more quickly in Cost Accounting. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Data Sources Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 Minor internal improvements have been made to  FastROCS ,  MaaS , and  MMDS .

 Orion 2021.1.1 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Orion 2021.1.1 Â¶ 
 
 Selected Training Videos Â¶ 
 New training and demonstration videos have been introduced, with special attention to
UI features that were changed or introduced in this version of Orion.  You can find links
to them in this section and in relevant places elsewhere in this manual.  For a list of all tutorial videos,
see  Orion Video Tutorials . 
 
 Data organization video Â¶ 
 The features for organizing data have been revamped significantly.  For an introduction, try
this video:
 Data Organization in Orion . 
 
 
 Discussion board videos Â¶ 
 Discussion boards are a new user interface feature introduced in this version, accessed
via an icon on the  Project   Data  page:
 Introducing Discussion Boards 
 We welcome your feedback on discussion boards after you have used them:
 Using Discussion Boards . 
 For more about discussion boards, see  Discussion boards . 
 
 
 3D modeling videos Â¶ 
 There are new badge and list features on the  3D   Modeling  page.
Here is an introduction:  Badges and Lists in Orion . 
 There are several more new videos about 3D modeling at  Orion Video Tutorials . 
 
 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 This release introduces a revamped  Project   Data  page which now uses a path- and folder-based file system for data organization. 
 A desired data location can be specified when uploading data, creating subfolders, or launching a Floe on the Job Form. 
 Users will be prompted to triage shared data and collections as part of data migration. 
 A âWhatâs Newâ dialog is now displayed on the  Home  page when users first login to Orion. 
 Many enhancements have been made to  3D   Modeling  page, including several new tools for protein editing. 
 Molecules, proteins, and other components of a dataset can now be identified using badges. 
 Tooltips in the  3D   Viewer  have been enhanced. 
 Support for grouping promoted parameters has been added to the Job Form. 
 A new discussion board Beta  feature is now available. 
 This release introduces Orion stack protection through rate-limiting. 
 Job cost email alerts can now be created. 
 A dedicated  Organization   Data  project has been added. The data in this project are available to all Organization users and are prepopulated with
OpenEye Data such as Collections used for virtual screening. 
 New Floes have been added to  Floe  packages including: 
 
 
 Non-Equilibrium Switching (NES) Floes in the MD Floe package. 
 Cluster Poses, FastROCS,  and FreeForm Pose Floes in the Large-Scale-Floes package. 
 Large-Scale Reaction Enumeration Floes in the Generative Design Floe package. 
 
 
 
 Dataset writing is now more robust with field names of different types. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Orion stack protection through rate-limiting has been implemented. 
 Job cost email alerts are now available. Organization admins can set Job cost limits alerts for the entire organization on the Profile page. In addition, users can set
Job cost limits alerts and Job termination thresholds for their own jobs on the Profile page. Job cost alerts can also be set prior to running a job on the Job Form.
These cost thresholds can be updated while a Job is running on the Job Status page. 
 This release introduces a new Discussion Board Beta . Saved discussions may contain notes, images, or snapshot links of the 3D Modeling or Analyze pages.
Discussions are accessible to all team members. 
 Substructure searching is now accessible from the databar filters. This functionality was previously available only on the Analyze page. 
 Cubes which are being throttled now show up with special coloring. 
 More information has been added to Job Debugging Data. 
 A new instance-draining state has been added, which allows jobs to continue running but prevents new jobs from using the instance. 
 Dataset writing is now more robust with field names of different types.
For new data being written to a dataset, it will be cast/coerced/promoted to the type of the existing dataset field. This matches what drconvert does.
When writing records, if an incompatible type of data for a given field name is seen, the writer generates a new alternate field and stores the data in
an alternate field rather than failing the writing process. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Home Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A âWhatâs Newâ dialog is now displayed on the Home page when users first login to Orion. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A dedicated Organization Data project has been added. Data in this project is visible to all Organization users and can be accessed from any project. In addition, the
Organization Data project is pre-populated with OpenEye-supplied data such as the Brood database, OpenEye-prepared third-party vendor collections for virtual screening,
tutorial datasets, and other data that can be used as input to some of the included Orion Floes.  Note : The Organization Data project is only visible to Organization
admins in the list of projects in the Navbar and Home page. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Organization admins now have control over the listing of projects on the Home page and Navbar on the Project Summary page. Organization admins can now toggle between
âShow Allâ Organization projects and âShow Ownâ projects. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The Project Data page has been overhauled and now uses a folder-based file system for organizing your data, instead of a flat view. 
 Within a project, data are organized into three main areas: 
 
 
 My Data â your private data. No other users have access to this data. 
 Team Data â data that are available to all project members. 
 Shared Spaces â data that are available to select project members, i.e. shared data among the selected project members. 
 
 
 
 New folders can be created from the Project Data page, when uploading data, and when launching a Floe from the Job Form. 
 A dedicated Organization Data project is available to everyone in the Organization and is located above the Project Data folder hierarchy. Data in
this project is visible to all Organization users and can be accessed from any project. 
 The path to a desired data location can be specified when uploading data, creating subfolders or when launching a Floe on the Job Form. 
 Folders and subfolders can be added to the  Favorite   Folders  space for quick and easy access. 
 Data are now shared by creating a workspace in the âShared Foldersâ main folder. Permissions can be set for each user added to the workspace. 
 Drag and drop functionality allows users to move collections, datasets, and/or files to the three main data areas, Trash can or other subfolders. 
 String Search will search within the current folder or all project folders, i.e.,  My Data,  Team Data or Shared Spaces. 
 Discussion boards Beta  can be created within a workspace to highlight and annotate data within that workspace, and can be viewed by all of that workspaceâs members. 
 As part of the data migration, users will be prompted to triage shared data and collections. Collections now belong to projects. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The 3D Viewer list is now record-focused. 
 Badges to identify molecules, proteins and other components of datasets have been added to the 3D Viewer list. 
 Tools for protein editing, including protonation state modification, capping terminal residues, and residue mutation have been added. 
 When mutating protein residues, multiple residues can be selected and users can walk through applying a mutation to each residue in the selected set. 
 Most of the small molecule editing tools can now be applied to proteins as well. 
 The 3D molecule editor now contains the same set of molecular fragment templates as the 2D sketcher. 
 An edited protein can be saved as a new dataset. 
 A new receptor in OEDesignUnit (DU) display has been added. 
 OEDesignUnit components can be edited and saved in place. 
 Receptor ligands can be edited but not in place. Users need to make a copy of the ligand before editing.  Note : Receptor proteins cannot be edited. 
 More options to save edited small molecules are now available. 
 Users can edit datasets they donât own in place but need to save them to new datasets. 
 A Discusson board Beta  was added for collaboration and replaces Saved Views. Saved Discusson boards can be retrieved from the Discussion menu on the
 Project   Data  page. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Improvements have been made to the small molecule editing tools. 
 Depiction tooltips in the list appear more reliably. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Improvements have been made to Data Handling. Users can now set the visibility for each column for each component of the user interface from the Data Handling dialog. 
 A Discusson board Beta  was added for collaboration and replaces Saved Views. Saved Discusson boards can be retrieved from the Discussion menu on the
Project Data page. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Spreadsheet fields now render correctly when users scroll to the right side of the spreadsheet. 
 Layout issues when using multiple plots in trellis mode have been fixed. 
 Molecules can now be sent to a Floe that takes a molecule fragment as input, for example, the Brood Floe. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Selecting conformer points in the Scatter plot no longer fails intermittently. 
 Saved color settings now persist. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe User Interface Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs Page: 
 
 
 Support for grouping promoted parameters has been added to the Job Form. 
 Support for a Job output folder path has been added to the Job Form. The default folder for Job output is âMy Dataâ, however, users can select
a different folder or create a new one. 
 Job Cost alert and termination thresholds can now be set on the Job Form. The default values are inherited from the âMy Job Cost Limitsâ set
on the usersâ Profile page. Job Cost thresholds for any given job can be disabled by clearing the current value or setting the value to zero.
The values of these thresholds can be adjusted on the Job Status page after a job has been launched. 
 Cubes in a running job are now colored specially when they are being throttled. More details are available in the Floe help. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs Page: 
 
 
 A bug has been fixed that caused Job parameters for jobs launched from the Orion command line interface (OCLI) from being displayed on the Job Status page. 
 A bug that prevented the Job Form from opening for certain Floes has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs Page: 
 
 
 An issue that sometimes caused duplicate input or output parameters to appear in the Job Form has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Data Sources Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Minor internal improvements have been made to  FastROCS ,  MaaS , and  MMDS . 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Mode Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Options to customize Job Cost email alerts for Organization admins have been added.

 2019.5.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2019.5.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 User roles and capabilities have been added to Orion. 
 Orion now supports shared views. 
 Support for filtering by string fields and molecule titles using the  Filters  dropdown in the  Databar  menu has been added. 
 Trellis plots have been added to the plot functionality. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 User roles and capabilities have been added to Orion. 
 
 
 Each user has  one role. The role, like the user, is associated
with an organization, and is defined by a set of capabilities. 
 Capabilities allow users to perform actions on Orion resources. 
 The following user roles are currently implemented: chemist, modeler, organization admin, and stack admin. 
 
 
 Chemists can upload or download datasets, run existing Floes, analyze datasets, share datasets,
view shared Views, and view their own job and storage costs. 
 Modelersâ capabilities include all chemists capabilities and the ability to create new Floes. 
 Organization admins, in addition to having the modelersâ capabilities, are able to see other usersâ jobs and costs. 
 Stack admins capabilities include all other usersâ capabilities and the ability to manage Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs). 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Users can now view their roles on the User Profile page. 
 Multifactor Authentication (MFA) now supports browser authentication, which can be configured on a per organization basis. 
 Support for macromolecular Crystallographic Information File (mmCIF) has been added to Classic Spruce Floes. 
 Deactivated scaling groups have been redesigned but are still retained in the Scaling Group chart. 
 Stack admins can now disable or enable various pages and features using the Roles API. 
 Non-admin users can now view cost accounting for all their jobs and storage charges. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Minor improvements have been made to the user interface for sharing resource(s) with multiple users. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Home Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Minor improvements have been made to cost accounting. All users can now view their own jobs and storage charges. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Dataset descriptions are now available in the Dataset table and can be edited using the  Actions  menu. 
 View  buttons that allow Simple or Detailed view modes have been added. 
 Files and collections in the  Trash  now have a Size column that allows sorting by either ascending or descending size. 
 Links to Jobs are now available in the Tags pop-up on each dataset row. 
 Single and Grid comparison modes have been added to the Card View modal. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now remove project tags from datasets. 
 Users can now apply or remove nested (child) project tags from datasets. In addition, users can also delete nested tags. 
 An issue with the modal dialog that occurred when users attempted to rename a dataset has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Viewer Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The Molecule Triage widget now allows random access to structures in a dataset. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Hidden column data are no longer loaded. 
 Saving a molecule with an active torsion will no longer lock up the 3D editor. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that caused molecule titles to fail to display in the conformers list has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Trellis plots have been added to the plot functionality. Trellis plots allow users to graph complex, multivariable datasets. 
 Support for filtering by string fields that include molecule titles has been added to the Analyze page. Users can access this functionality by using
the  Filters  dropdown in the  Databar  menu. 
 Users can now hide surface and grid data in the spreadsheet. 
 Users can now  save, load, and share Views from the  Databar  menu. A View is a complete Analyze state that includes the associated data. 
 Users can now save and apply templates of settings in the plot panel. 
 The logarithmic scale is now enabled for regression analysis. 
 Molecule conformers can now be tagged. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused rounding errors for small data values in the spreadsheets and plots has been fixed. 
 Columns can now be added correctly to spreadsheets when performing linear regression. In addition, clearer coefficients are shown in the formula. 
 A Query Molecule column is now added to the spreadsheet and the  Filters  dropdown in the  Databar  menu when users create a new substructure query. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Improvements have been made for columns with long lists of categorical options in the Plot options panel. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Support has been added for  secret_source  input types. 
 3D molecules are now supported in the fragment selection Floe parameters. 
 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 A Help modal has been added to explain Cube icons and colors. 
 Errors now appear on their respective Cubes in the Floe. 
 Cubes are now sorted  by rank in the Job submission form. 
 An option to download job logs directly instead of viewing them in a browser has been added. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Job parameters are now visible for jobs launched programmatically using OCLI. 
 Multiple choice parameters with settings of   many=True  are now handled properly. 
 A deleted Floe is no longer listed in the package filter for available Floes. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue with the port counter animations has been fixed. 
 Minor improvements have been made to the fragment selection and MDL query inputs to Floes.

 2020.1.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2020.1.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 A new Quick Search functionality allows searching and filtering of
molecules by title and other text fields. The search is available from
the Active Data bar and allows * and ? wildcards. 
 Cube  metrics  graphs are now available in the ââ¦â Cube menu on the Job Status page. 
 External Collections are now supported. This allows existing data on S3 to
be used without making a copy and incurring additional storage fees. 
 A change was made affecting GPU package  manifests  which speeds up jobs, but breaks uploads of old packages. 
 Job disk  quotas  are now enforced in order to protect jobs from other tasks running on the same instance. 
 Cube home  file systems  are now mounted read-only, and scratch is mounted no-exec. 
 Multiple datasets and files can now be used together for a single parameter
when launching a job. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The layout for scaling groups on the System page has been simplified. 
 The Active Data bar has an improved layout. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 System Status and Notifications pop-over panels are now easier to close. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Home Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The News Feed has been removed from the Home page. 
 Users are now added automatically as project members when sharing resources. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The Expenses chart has been enlarged. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Saved Views are now listed in chronological order on the Project page. A Saved View is a snapshot
of the Active Data displayed in the Analyze page, and combines data with visual presentation. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now remove project tags from datasets. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Tags are now color-coded. Private tags are yellow, Project tags are pink, and System tags are light blue. 
 When viewing datasets with multiple molecule columns, users can now select
which molecule column to show in the Card Viewer. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can no longer apply project tags to non-project resources. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Viewer Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A new viewer Toolbar layout has been added. 
 Rendering styles for 3D molecules, along with viewing transformation and
clipping planes, are now included in shared views. 
 Jobs run from the Analyze and 3D Modeling pages are now tagged. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that affected the correct perception of protein-ligand interactions has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue in which the Triage slider in the Viewer list would sometimes
disappear has been fixed. 
 A bug which caused the the Triage slider to malfunction when multiple
datasets are in triage mode was corrected. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A new Quick Search functionality that filters molecules by title and other
text fields has been added to the Active Data bar. 
 Plot axes labels now have bigger fonts by default. 
 Data points can now be plotted or colored by dataset membership. 
 Notches can now be applied to boxplots. This feature is available under the Plot Options of the Boxplot. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that caused the Scatterplot to miss some of the points when coloring a categorical column has been fixed. 
 A warning is now displayed if the Property Calculation microservice is not available. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The spreadsheet row background colors no longer shift when scrolled vertically or horizontally. 
 A bug that caused the legend position to move when viewing Trellis plots has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Jobs are now tagged. 
 Cube details (in addition to Cube metrics) are now available in the ââ¦â Cube menu. 
 The Job Priority slider on the Job Status page has been removed. 
 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Minor improvements to layout management 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Performance when navigating between Floe page tabs has been improved. 
 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Job errors on the Job Status page are now clearly reported. 
 Some issues that impacted the deletion of jobs from the Jobs list have been fixed. 
 Navigating to the Floes page after starting a job has been improved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 An Account Balance History bar graph has been added to the Accounting page. 
 A simplified view for scaling groups has been added to the System page. 
 An organization can now use a custom pip configuration. 
 An organization can now use a custom TLS certificate.

 2021.2.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2021.2.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 The 2021.2.1 release marks a major milestone in OrionÂ® releases. The Orion Platform release is now
decoupled from the Science Suites or Floe packages release. Science Suites now closely track the Apps and Toolkits releases. 
 Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe description. Title matches are listed before description matches. 
 Floes are now sorted by title rather than by name. 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  Analyze  and  3D   Modeling  pages. 
 New icons have been introduced for collections  , datasets  , and files  . 
 Read-only folders, collections, datasets, and files have special icons marked with a   icon. 
 Shared Spaces can be identified by a   icon. 
 Job cost notification now reports estimated job cost plus OpenEyeâs markup. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Job cost notification now reports estimated job cost plus OpenEyeâs markup. 
 The requirements for  finalize dataset  task have been increased to  cpu=1 ,  memory=1024.0 ,  disk_space=22000.0 . 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A scheduler issue in Floe networking causing cyclic Floes to deadlock has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A request to cancel a running rate-limited job sent from  Orion-client  is no longer throttled. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Documents and molecular files uploaded as âProject Filesâ are now placed in Team Data. No ETL Floes are run on these files. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Edits of project descriptions can now be saved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Collections, datasets, and files are now labeled with unique icons. A   icon depicts a collection, a  
icon depicts a dataset, and a   icon depicts a file. 
 Read-only folders, collections, datasets, and files have special icons marked with a   icon. For example, a read-only folder
will be denoted as  . 
 Shared Spaces can be identified by a   icon. 
 Dataset depictions are displayed faster. 
 Shared spaces can now be deleted. 
 Discussion Boards can now be moved between My Data and Shared Spaces. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Moving a folder now moves the folder and all of its contents. 
 A bug that limited the number of folders listed in the Path Selector when saving or moving datasets has been fixed.  Users can now load more folders, if they exist. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused the Active Data list to sometimes list search results instead of the active data has been fixed. 
 Selecting âView Resultsâ on the  Jobs  page now searches all folders in the current project and displays all resource types. 
 Searching for resources by Job Id on the  Project   Data  page could show those resources in the Trash and Active Data folders as well. This issue has been fixed. 
 Moving a dataset from Active Data to another project now clears the data from Active Data. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  3D   Modeling  page. 
 Discussion Boards will throw a warning if a snapshot is missing datasets. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Nucleic acids are displayed by default when they are part of a DesignUnit. 
 When editing a protein, protein mutation tools now work properly. 
 A ligand in a DesignUnit can now be edited without the associated protein. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 3D Modeling snapshots in Discussion Boards now include grid contour information. 
 Memory management improvements have been made to the  3D   Modeling  page. 
 Deleting a pinned record now removes it from the Objects list. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Discussion Boards can now be created and loaded directly from the  Analyze  page. 
 Discussion Boards will throw a warning if a snapshot is missing datasets. 
 Loading of data is now faster, particularly for smaller datasets and when filtering. 
 The Databar has been restyled and now more prominently labels the number of active and total filters. 
 Substructure filters now show the substructure with the filter. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused some inconsistent vertical and/or horizontal scrolling behavior in the spreadsheet has been fixed. 
 Binning of columns with the same name from different datasets now properly merges the data. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Pinned columns in the spreadsheet are now remembered. 
 A bug that caused the spreadsheet scrollbar to sometimes disappear has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe description. Title matches are listed before description matches. 
 Floes are now sorted by title rather than by name. 
 SecretInputParameters are now supported in the UI. 
 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 R-groups and isotopes can now be set in the sketcher via a right-click on atoms. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Parameters fixed in the Floe Editor can now be removed. 
 The Start Job button in the Floe dialog could be disabled if a String parameter was
required but had an empty string as a default. This issue has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Ledger entries now load more quickly in Cost Accounting. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Data Sources Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 Minor internal improvements have been made to  FastROCS ,  MaaS , and  MMDS .

 2022.3.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2022.3.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 Visualize Enhanced Stereochemistry in CXSMILES Â¶ 
 Support for  CXSMILES  format has been added. Enhanced stereochemistry group information
can be visualized in 2D depictions. 
 
 
 CXSMILES Depiction Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Improved  Dataset Export Â¶ 
 The user interface and features for  exporting datasets from the  Data  page have been improved. 
 
 
 User Interface Improvements Â¶ 
 Various design improvements have been made to parts of  Orion .  See, for
example, the Packages upload tab on the  Floe  page. 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 CXSMILES Â¶ 
 Support for  CXSMILES  format has been added.  .cxsmiles  format files can now be imported or exported.
Currently, only the enhanced stereochemistry group information feature is supported and can be visualized in 2D depictions on the
Analyze page (for example,  spreadsheet ),   Tile View , and the 2D Sketcher. 
 
 
 Preserve Data of a Removed User Â¶ 
 An inactive user can now be removed from an organization. Ownership of the userâs data is transferred to project owners
or a designated organization admin. Users can send a request to  support @ eyesopen . com  to remove a user from an organization. 
 
 
 Downloadable Cost Data Â¶ 
 A detailed report of storage costs by project can now be generated using OCLI.  Managed Service users, see  the documentation on the ocli cost export command . SaaS users can send a request to  support @ eyesopen . com  to obtain a copy of the comma-separated-value (CSV) file containing a breakdown of cost
data. 
 
 
 AWS Tiering Â¶ 
 Amazon Web Services (AWS)  S3 Intelligent Tiering  is
now enabled for Orion. Per Amazon: 
 
 Archived data have the same low-latency and high-throughput performance of S3 standard 
 The Infrequent Access (30 days) tier saves up to 40% on storage costs 
 The Archive Instant Access tier (90 days) saves up to 68% on storage costs 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 Downloading and Exporting Â¶ 
 Dataset export has been improved. Users can now choose a preferred file format and on clicking Export,
an Exports folder is automatically created, if it doesnât already exist. Users can monitor the progress of
the export in the Notification panel, and after file download, optionally move or delete the exported file
from the Exports folder. 
 
 
 Support of String Columns Â¶ 
 String columns can now be displayed in  Tile View . 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 Orion would not let users delete a folder if another folder with the same name was already in the Trash.
This has been fixed by automatically appending sequential numbers to duplicate file names in the Trash. 
 Tagging molecules in the spreadsheet would sometimes cause unexpected scrolling behavior. This has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The function formerly named âProtonateâ in the 3D Viewer (Modeling/Proteins/Protonation/) has been renamed, for
clarity, âOptimize H-Bond Network.â 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 JSON data fields are viewable in the spreadsheet on the  Analyze page . 
 Categorical string fields can now be filtered using a âfree textâ setting. This allows
creation of filters that can match multiple distinct categorical values that contain a
provided string. 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 Copy to Clipboard from the Analyze page lost 2D coordinates of some molecules.  This has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 Parameter titles are no longer automatically capitalized.  Orion now honors the Floe developerâs settings. 
 The memory and disk metrics for parallel Cubes now report the maximum usage as opposed to the average. 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The Cancel and Start Job buttons are now fixed at the bottom of the Job Submission form so that itâs no longer
necessary to scroll to find them.

 Sketcher Tool 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Sketcher Tool Â¶ 
 The Sketcher allows you to draw a molecule with the assistance of tools in its left-hand tool bar. 
 
 
 The Sketcher, Used to Draw a New Molecule Â¶ 
 
 Hover over the tool bar icons for tips on using them to select, draw, and manage parts of a molecule. 
 The Sketcher is available on the  Project   Data  page and in other contexts where you want to specify
a molecule, such as on the  Molecule Search  page. 
 Select a tool in the toolbar and hover over icons to see tool tips.
You can sketch a molecule with such tools as Fragment ( ), Templates ( ),
and Atoms ( ). Other tools allow you to select, erase parts of a sketch,
clean up the molecule geometry, undo and redo
a change, fit the molecule to the window, clear the current sketch, pan, and zoom in or out. 
 
 Specify an Atom Â¶ 
 Select the Atom ( ) tool and its arrow to display a list of elements and their associated letters,
such as S for sulfur.  You can also pick an element from the periodic table using the  ...  button. If you
select an element first, you can place it on the molecule by clicking the position in the molecule sketch. 
 To specify an atom, you also can hover on the symbol at the end of a bond and use a keystroke to identify
the element: 
 
 
 Specifying an Element Â¶

 2019.3.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2019.3.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 Orion expenses are now available in admin mode. Orion organization admins can query or filter job costs or other AWS costs. 
 Orion organization admins can now modify certain options of Auto Scaling Groups (ASG). 
 Orion now supports auto logout or timeout following a period of user inactivity. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Orion now supports auto logout or timeout following a period of user inactivity.
By default, users will be logged out after 15 minutes of inactivity.
When logging back in, users are redirected to the last page they were working on.
 Note : A backend timeout setting of â0:00:00â should never automatically log out a user. 
 Password validation has been added to ensure a minimum password length, and that passwords are not common names. 
 Notifications have been reformatted to be more clear. 
 The Current Project is now more easily visible in  Project   Data , job results, and dialog modals. 
 Old tutorial popups have been removed. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that affected the reading and writing of datasets with IntVecs and blob fields has been fixed.
The datarecord can now roundtrip negative numbers inside of an IntVec where the high bit is a multiple of 8. 
 An issue that impacted running jobs on a scaling group where the CPU count is not a power of 2 has been resolved. 
 A bug that affected running a job on a spot instance and then terminating the instance has been fixed.
Running jobs are no longer terminated when a spot instance goes away. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users will now get correct notifications when a resource is shared with a project or organization. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Home Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The My Expenses tab now includes AWS data storage costs. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Minor improvements have been made to the Project Summary page. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The Project Data page has been redesigned for a better user experience. 
 Datasets and files can now be moved between projects. 
 Users can now archive datasets and/or restore datasets from the Archive folder. 
 Datasets and file IDs are now displayed. However, users cannot sort datasets and files by ID. 
 Tagging on Project Data: 
 
 
 Users can now add and remove tags inline in the dataset row. 
 Users can now drop a resource onto a project tag. 
 Hierarchical tagging has been added. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Multiple items can now be restored from the Trash at the same time. 
 Collections can now be renamed. 
 An error that prevented users from deleting collections or files has been fixed. 
 A bug that prevented files with .dat and .mmd extensions from uploading into Orion has been fixed. 
 A bug that prevented large datasets from being finalized has been fixed.
Users can now finalize datasets and, additionally, interact with unfinalized datasets (share, delete, etc.). 
 The logic for bulk re-sharing of multiple datasets has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now filter items by owner. 
 Bulk tagging of multiple resources has been fixed. 
 Switching between files, datasets, and collections no longer breaks the list. 
 Selecting text from Project Data table rows is now enabled. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Viewer Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A  new menu bar has been added to the 3D viewer. Users can now access the following menus: 
 
 
 View 
 Select 
 Modeling 
 Tools 
 Help 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The 3D sketcher no longer throws an error message when saving molecules. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A Focused molecule is now displayed in the 3D viewer. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The handling of large datasets has been improved. Plot data now loads incrementally and load progress is shown with a progress bar. 
 Coloring spreadsheet cells by value using the Heatmap option in the spreadsheet menu has been added. 
 Auto-binning for numeric/categorical columns in the plot is now enabled. 
 A Lasso selection option for scatter plots has been added. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that affected the categorical coloring of points when some of the points were invalid has been fixed. 
 Cancelling the plot load no longer breaks the plot. 
 Applying filters now triggers fewer automatic plot reloads. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An error that occurred when applying a tag to a record selected in the plot has been fixed. 
 The plot no longer rescales when filters are applied. 
 The positioning of molecule depictions over the plot has been fixed. 
 Minor improvements to scrolling and then sorting the spreadsheet have been made. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Iterative Design Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 In the 3D Editor, a co-crystallized ligand can now be edited inside a protein. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The model name is now being added to the plot. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Cube and Floe descriptions now appear in the Info panel when selected. 
 Support for âcollection_sinkâ parameter types has been added. 
 Performance when dragging Cubes, especially in Firefox browsers, has been improved. 
 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Jobs can now be searched by job ID. 
 An option to filter jobs by state (i.e., queued, running, stopping, and complete) has been added. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 The connections between finished Cubes should not get stuck in an active/orange state. 
 Selecting multiple Cubes in a group now gives the correct information in the Info panel. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Clicking  back to Jobs  from the Job Details page now retains the previous state of the Jobs list. 
 FieldParameters in the Job Form are now being handled better. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Data Sources Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Numerous improvements have been made to the  MMDS-Orion  interface.
Please consult the  MMDS  documentation for more details. 
 Minor improvements have been made to the  FastROCS-Orion  interface. Please consult the  FastROCS  documentation for more details. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Mode Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Scaling Groups: 
 
 
 The Scaling Groups page layout has been reorganized. 
 Orion organization admins can now modify certain options of ASGs. 
 
 
 
 Features: 
 
 
 Orion organization admins can now enable and disable features in the System. 
 
 
 
 Cost Accounting: 
 
 
 Users and Projects lists are now interactive. Users can now filter costs by user name or project name. 
 Infrastructure Expenses such as AWS Cost and Storage costs are now displayed in the Spend charts.

 Citation 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Citation Â¶ 
 
 Orion  Â®  Floes Â¶ 
 To cite use of an Orion-based Floe package, please use the following: 
 OpenEye   < package - name >   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 For example: 
 OpenEye   Classic   Floes   0.11.2 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The version number for a Floe package is displayed on the first page of the packageâs release notes.  For
example:  https://docs.eyesopen.com/floe/modules/classic-floes/docs/source/releasenotes.html . 
 
 
 Toolkits and Applications Â¶ 
 To cite  OpenEye toolkits or applications used in your work, please use the following: 
 OpenEye   Toolkits   [ or   Applications ]   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 For example: 
 OpenEye   Toolkits   2023.1 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The Applications and Toolkits are released as a package, multiple times per year.  The first
part of the version number designates the calendar year.   The version number appears on the summary
document for the package . 
 If you want to cite an individual application or toolkit, you can use the syntax: 
 < product   name >   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 where  <product name>  is: 
 
 OEChem TK 
 OEDepict TK 
 FastROCS TK 
 Grapheme TK 
 GraphSim TK 
 Lexichem TK 
 OEMedChem TK 
 MolProp TK 
 Quacpac TK 
 OEFF TK 
 OEDocking TK 
 Omega TK 
 Shape TK 
 Spicoli TK 
 Spruce TK 
 Szmap TK 
 Szybki TK 
 Zap TK 
 AFITT Application 
 BROOD Application 
 EON Application 
 OEDocking Application 
 OMEGA Application 
 PICTO Application 
 pKa-Prospector Application 
 QUACPAC Application 
 ROCS Application 
 SiteHopper Application 
 SPRUCE Application 
 SZMAP Application 
 SZYBKI Application 
 VIDA Application 
 
 You can use the version number of the individual Application or Toolkit.   For example: 
 SZYBKI   Application   2.5.1.2 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 

 Szybki   TK   2.5.1.2 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The first documentation pages give the product names and version numbers, as in  https://docs.eyesopen.com/applications/szybki/index.html  and
 https://docs.eyesopen.com/toolkits/python/szybkitk/index.html . 
 
 
 OpenEye Web Services Â¶ 
 To cite use of the Macromolecular Data Service (MMDS) web service, please use the syntax: 
 Macromolecular   Data   Service   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 For example: 
 Macromolecular   Data   Service   1.1 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The MMDS version number appears on the web serviceâs release notes . 
 To cite use of the FastROCS  TM  server, please use the syntax: 
 FastROCS   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 For example: 
 FastROCS   1.4.4 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The FastROCS version number appears on the web serviceâs release notes . 
 To cite use of the Molecules as a Service (MaaS) web service, please use the syntax: 
 MaaS   < version - number >.   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 For example: 
 MaaS   1.0 .   OpenEye ,   Cadence   Molecular   Sciences ,   Santa   Fe ,   NM .   http : // www . eyesopen . com . 
 
 
 The MaaS version number appears on the web serviceâs release notes .

 2022.3.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2022.3.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 Visualize Enhanced Stereochemistry in CXSMILES Â¶ 
 Support for  CXSMILES  format has been added. Enhanced stereochemistry group information
can be visualized in 2D depictions. 
 
 
 CXSMILES Depiction Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Improved  Dataset Export Â¶ 
 The user interface and features for  exporting datasets from the  Data  page have been improved. 
 
 
 User Interface Improvements Â¶ 
 Various design improvements have been made to parts of  Orion .  See, for
example, the Packages upload tab on the  Floe  page. 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 CXSMILES Â¶ 
 Support for  CXSMILES  format has been added.  .cxsmiles  format files can now be imported or exported.
Currently, only the enhanced stereochemistry group information feature is supported and can be visualized in 2D depictions on the
Analyze page (for example,  spreadsheet ),   Tile View , and the 2D Sketcher. 
 
 
 Preserve Data of a Removed User Â¶ 
 An inactive user can now be removed from an organization. Ownership of the userâs data is transferred to project owners
or a designated organization admin. Users can send a request to  support @ eyesopen . com  to remove a user from an organization. 
 
 
 Downloadable Cost Data Â¶ 
 A detailed report of storage costs by project can now be generated using OCLI.  Managed Service users, see  the documentation on the ocli cost export command . SaaS users can send a request to  support @ eyesopen . com  to obtain a copy of the comma-separated-value (CSV) file containing a breakdown of cost
data. 
 
 
 AWS Tiering Â¶ 
 Amazon Web Services (AWS)  S3 Intelligent Tiering  is
now enabled for Orion. Per Amazon: 
 
 Archived data have the same low-latency and high-throughput performance of S3 standard 
 The Infrequent Access (30 days) tier saves up to 40% on storage costs 
 The Archive Instant Access tier (90 days) saves up to 68% on storage costs 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 Downloading and Exporting Â¶ 
 Dataset export has been improved. Users can now choose a preferred file format and on clicking Export,
an Exports folder is automatically created, if it doesnât already exist. Users can monitor the progress of
the export in the Notification panel, and after file download, optionally move or delete the exported file
from the Exports folder. 
 
 
 Support of String Columns Â¶ 
 String columns can now be displayed in  Tile View . 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 Orion would not let users delete a folder if another folder with the same name was already in the Trash.
This has been fixed by automatically appending sequential numbers to duplicate file names in the Trash. 
 Tagging molecules in the spreadsheet would sometimes cause unexpected scrolling behavior. This has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The function formerly named âProtonateâ in the 3D Viewer (Modeling/Proteins/Protonation/) has been renamed, for
clarity, âOptimize H-Bond Network.â 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 JSON data fields are viewable in the spreadsheet on the  Analyze page . 
 Categorical string fields can now be filtered using a âfree textâ setting. This allows
creation of filters that can match multiple distinct categorical values that contain a
provided string. 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 Copy to Clipboard from the Analyze page lost 2D coordinates of some molecules.  This has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 Parameter titles are no longer automatically capitalized.  Orion now honors the Floe developerâs settings. 
 The memory and disk metrics for parallel Cubes now report the maximum usage as opposed to the average. 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The Cancel and Start Job buttons are now fixed at the bottom of the Job Submission form so that itâs no longer
necessary to scroll to find them.

 2020.1.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2020.1.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 A new Quick Search functionality allows searching and filtering of
molecules by title and other text fields. The search is available from
the Active Data bar and allows * and ? wildcards. 
 Cube  metrics  graphs are now available in the ââ¦â Cube menu on the Job Status page. 
 External Collections are now supported. This allows existing data on S3 to
be used without making a copy and incurring additional storage fees. 
 A change was made affecting GPU package  manifests  which speeds up jobs, but breaks uploads of old packages. 
 Job disk  quotas  are now enforced in order to protect jobs from other tasks running on the same instance. 
 Cube home  file systems  are now mounted read-only, and scratch is mounted no-exec. 
 Multiple datasets and files can now be used together for a single parameter
when launching a job. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The layout for scaling groups on the System page has been simplified. 
 The Active Data bar has an improved layout. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 System Status and Notifications pop-over panels are now easier to close. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Home Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The News Feed has been removed from the Home page. 
 Users are now added automatically as project members when sharing resources. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The Expenses chart has been enlarged. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Saved Views are now listed in chronological order on the Project page. A Saved View is a snapshot
of the Active Data displayed in the Analyze page, and combines data with visual presentation. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now remove project tags from datasets. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Tags are now color-coded. Private tags are yellow, Project tags are pink, and System tags are light blue. 
 When viewing datasets with multiple molecule columns, users can now select
which molecule column to show in the Card Viewer. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can no longer apply project tags to non-project resources. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Viewer Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A new viewer Toolbar layout has been added. 
 Rendering styles for 3D molecules, along with viewing transformation and
clipping planes, are now included in shared views. 
 Jobs run from the Analyze and 3D Modeling pages are now tagged. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that affected the correct perception of protein-ligand interactions has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue in which the Triage slider in the Viewer list would sometimes
disappear has been fixed. 
 A bug which caused the the Triage slider to malfunction when multiple
datasets are in triage mode was corrected. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 A new Quick Search functionality that filters molecules by title and other
text fields has been added to the Active Data bar. 
 Plot axes labels now have bigger fonts by default. 
 Data points can now be plotted or colored by dataset membership. 
 Notches can now be applied to boxplots. This feature is available under the Plot Options of the Boxplot. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that caused the Scatterplot to miss some of the points when coloring a categorical column has been fixed. 
 A warning is now displayed if the Property Calculation microservice is not available. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 The spreadsheet row background colors no longer shift when scrolled vertically or horizontally. 
 A bug that caused the legend position to move when viewing Trellis plots has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Jobs are now tagged. 
 Cube details (in addition to Cube metrics) are now available in the ââ¦â Cube menu. 
 The Job Priority slider on the Job Status page has been removed. 
 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Minor improvements to layout management 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 Floe Editor: 
 
 
 Performance when navigating between Floe page tabs has been improved. 
 
 
 
 Jobs page: 
 
 
 Job errors on the Job Status page are now clearly reported. 
 Some issues that impacted the deletion of jobs from the Jobs list have been fixed. 
 Navigating to the Floes page after starting a job has been improved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Admin Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 An Account Balance History bar graph has been added to the Accounting page. 
 A simplified view for scaling groups has been added to the System page. 
 An organization can now use a custom pip configuration. 
 An organization can now use a custom TLS certificate.

 Molecule Search Page 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Molecule Search Page Â¶ 
 The  Molecule   Search  page provides the ability to search using similarity in two or three dimensions;
with substructures; using matches with search terms; and by molecule title. 
 The searches are comparable to the searches performed previously by  OpenEye âs MaaS and  FastROCS  web
services.  Searches can be launched from a number of places in the  Orion  user interface,
and results can be stored in files or datasets for use in other  Orion  operations. 
 
 
 Figure 1.  Molecule Search Â¶ 
 
 You can search with a variety of criteria. 
 For a demonstration of the 2D feature, see the following video. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Search by Sketch Â¶ 
 You can sketch a molecule with such tools as Fragment ( ), Templates ( ),
and Atoms ( ).  You can also send a molecule from other
pages such as  Analyze,  by selecting the molecule, right clicking, and choosing
 Send   to   Search.  Then select a database from
the list on the right side of the screen, such as Enamine Simple,
and enter search parameters (in this example, the fingerprint type,
Tanimoto score, and maximum number of hits). 
 
 
 Figure 2.  100 Matches for a query. Â¶ 
 
 You can use any of the search results as input for a new search.  Click on a molecule
in the search results to select it, then click on its kebab menu ( ), and select
 New   Search.   Alternatively, you
can copy the found molecule as a title, SMILES string,
or MOL file. 
 
 
 Figure 3.  Use a search result for further work. Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Figure 4.  3D results from a preceding 2D search result. Â¶ 
 
 Notice that a toggle allows you to choose 2D or 3D representations of the search results, after
a 3D similarity search. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Save Results Â¶ 
 You can save the search results to a dataset or file, or
you can send the results directly to the  Analyze  page. 
 
 
 Figure 5.  Retaining the results of a search. Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Search History Â¶ 
 Orion  retains the history of your searches automatically.
They are cleared after 30 days unless you pin them. 
 
 
 Figure 6.  Pin queries to save them indefinitely. Â¶ 
 
 
 
 Search by Title Â¶ 
 A title search will populate the Sketcher with any structure
in the selected database that matches the name. 
 
 
 Figure 7.  Result of a search for the title âAspirin.â Â¶

 2023.3.2 Release Notes 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2023.3.2 Release Notes Â¶ 
 
 Floe Page Â¶ 
 
 Inputs are repopulated when a job is rerun.  Previously, if you clicked the  RE-RUN   JOB 
button, input datasets and files did not always repopulate the job form. 
 The  Job   Parameters  shows correct values used to run the job including when
nondefault values are used. 
 
 
 
 
 2023.3.1 Release Notes Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 The new  Molecule Search page  provides the ability to search using similarity in two or three dimensions;
with substructures; using matches with search terms; and by molecule title. 
 On the Analyze page, selected spreadsheet columns can be included while exporting from a dataset. 
 Selected cells can be copied directly to the system clipboard while using the Analyze page. 
 A procedure is documented for  deleting a user , which reassigns the projects
and data owned by the deleted user. 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 Sketcher Improvements Â¶ 
 The  Sketcher  has been updated with new pan and zoom icons and with improved features for specifying
atoms in a sketched molecule.  The improvements are available wherever the Sketcher is employed, including the new
 Molecule Search page . 
 
 
 Collection Metadata Â¶ 
 Pregenerated  metadata  are provided for some collections, which facilitates work with those
collections by allowing immediate visualization of the metadata. 
 
 
 
 Analyze Page Â¶ 
 
 Tethered Points and Spreadsheet Rows Â¶ 
 When a point in the plot is selected, the spreadsheet  navigates  to the row representing that point. You can also select a row in the spreadsheet
and see the corresponding point identified in the plot. 
 
 
 Copy and Paste of Spreadsheet Cells Â¶ 
 Cells in a spreadsheet can be copied to the  clipboard . 
 
 
 
 Floe Page Â¶ 
 The arrangement of job information on the Floe page  Jobs  tab was improved.
The job details are at the top of the page, so you can easily see the job cost and tags, and so forth.
The  Results  and  Reports  accordions default to closed but can be expanded for
more information. 
 
 
 Information for Programmers Â¶ 
 Changes and topics related to programming Orion Floes and Cubes are documented  in the Programming Guide .

 2023.1.1 Release Notes 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2023.1.1 Release Notes Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 New receptor features: New features  have been introduced for enabling and modifying receptor constraints  directly on the 3D Modeling page . 
 Improved Floe user interface:  You can navigate to a floe within a hierarchical list , on the Floe page. 
 New project management feature:  A new Project Admin role can be assigned by the project owner , to delegate some management of users. 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 You can assign a Project Admin role   to other users. 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The user interface for moving items has been improved. 
 Substructure filter operation has been improved over multiple datasets.
(Substructure search was incorrectly reporting in some instances that âsome calculations failed.â) 
 
 
 
 
 Floe Page Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 You can navigate to a floe within a hierarchical list , on the Floe page. 
 Performance of some Floes has been improved, including some ETL operations. 
 
 
 
 Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 Admin users will get a useful error message if they try to run a job from a project
to which they donât belong. 
 When a parameter is set on one copy of a cube, it no longer appears as if it
has been set on all copies of that cube, so long as they all have different names. 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 New features  have been introduced for enabling and modifying receptor constraints  directly on the 3D Modeling page . 
 The 3D Viewer now auto-fits when: 
 
 First coming to a scene, 
 Nothing is visible, and 
 New datasets have been added. 
 
 If nothing is currently displayed in the 3D Viewer when a dataset is made active,
the first record of that dataset is automatically displayed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 Performance of the page has been improved when displaying large datasets.  Also, the display replots more frequently,
based on the elapsed time; previously the display updated after a certain amount of data had been displayed. 
 
 
 
 Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 The 3D viewer is more robust when displaying certain problematic molecules, such
as some with geometrically deformed ring systems. 
 
 
 
 
 Programmersâ Notes Â¶ 
 Changes and topics related to programming of Orion Floes and cubes are documented  in the Programming Guide .

 2022.2.1 Release 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2022.2.1 Release Â¶ 
 
 Highlights Â¶ 
 
 
 Floes are now organized by category. They can appear
in multiple categories. The following categories are available in the 2022.2 release: 
 
 Created   in   Floe   Editor 
 Packages 
 Product-based 
 Role-based 
 Solution-based 
 Task-based 
 
 
 Floes now have a new âBrief,â which is a short description of the Floe.
Floe Search functionality now searches by Floe title and Floe brief. 
 Users can now create shareable links to the current view of the  3D   Modeling  and  Analyze  pages. 
 Downloadable dataset, file, and folder links can now be generated from the Data page and shared with other users. 
 A new login experience is available. All users are now guided through the appropriate login process
for their underlying implementation. 
 A new load screen is now displayed on login or when Orion is loading certain resources such as Floe reports. 
 
 
 
 
 General Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Support for new Intel processors has been added. 
 For Floes that use GPUs, the  NVIDIA driver version is now 470.103.01. 
 A userâs full name is now displayed on the Navigation bar. 
 A local account is now locked after multiple failed change password attempts. 
 The message in the Job debug collection info email has been improved. The path to the debug file is now specified,
and the message includes a reminder
that users must be logged into Orion to access the file. 
 
 
 
 
 Major Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that impacted the scale up of ASGs when there are not enough instances has been fixed. 
 Large GPU instances are now evenly apportioned. 
 An issue that caused some jobs to hang indefinitely has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 In certain situations, users were not able to cancel running jobs. This issue has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Summary Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 The Project Summary page has been redesigned and improved. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Data Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Downloadable dataset or file links can now be generated from the Data page and shared with other users. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 When launching Floes from the Project Data page, the output path option is now present. 
 
 
 
 
 
 3D Modeling Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now create a shareable link to the current view on the 3D Modeling page using the
Snapshot button in the menu bar. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Analyze Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Users can now create a shareable link to the current view of the Analyze page using the Snapshot button in the menu bar. 
 Substructure filtering now allows the inclusion of query features for more useful substructure matching. 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 An issue that caused newly added ratings and properties to be unavailable for filtering until an Orion reload has been fixed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Floe UI Â¶ 
 
 New Features Â¶ 
 
 
 Floes are now classified into the following categories: 
 
 
 Created   in   Floe   Editor 
 Packages 
 Product-based 
 Role-based 
 Solution-based 
 Task-based 
 
 
 For a complete description of the categories in the 2022.2.1 release, see  the documentation about the Floe page in this manual . 
 
 The Floe browser allows users to search for any Floe in any category and the state of search and category path will persist. 
 Floe search is enabled whenever users select any Floe filter such as  Favorities ,  Recently   Used ,   Analyze   Enabled ,  3D   Modeling   Enabled , and  My   Floes . 
 Floe search is limited to current category: 
 
 
 Only sub-categories of the current category are shown as options in the dropdown. 
 Searching for a Floe with matching title or brief returns results only in the current category or its sub-categories. 
 The Floe search term is shown as a tag. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Minor Bug Fixes Â¶ 
 
 
 A bug that prevented sorting of datasets when choosing a dataset for Floe input has been fixed.
